publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3934 Kenneth Gibson: Largs Youth Theatre—That the Parliament congratulates Largs Youth Theatre (LYT) on being chosen to perform Blackout, a short play by Glasgow writer Davey Anderson, at the Lyceum Theatre in Edinburgh on 10 June 2009 as part of the National Theatre New Connections Regional Festival; notes that LYT is one of nine Scottish youth companies performing new plays for and about young people by some of Scotland’s best contemporary playwrights as part of the New Connections programme; is aware that LYT, founded in 2002, has almost 200 students ranging in age from three to 19 and strongly supported by enthusiastic local volunteers from the wider Largs community; recognises the hard work and dedication of the young students who will participate in Blackout, the leadership and commitment provided by the directors of LYT, Andrew McGregor and Marianne Yeomans, and wishes everyone connected with LYT continued success in the future. Supported by: Aileen Campbell*, Michael Matheson*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Stuart McMillan*, Sandra White*, Stewart Maxwell*, Ross Finnie*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3934 Largs Youth Theatre (lodged on 21 April 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Anne McLaughlin*
S3M-3934 Largs Youth Theatre (lodged on 21 April 2009) Elaine Smith*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-3934 Kenneth Gibson: Largs Youth Theatre—That the Parliament congratulates Largs Youth Theatre (LYT) on being chosen to perform Blackout, a short play by Glasgow writer Davey Anderson, at the Lyceum Theatre in Edinburgh on 10 June 2009 as part of the National Theatre New Connections Regional Festival; notes that LYT is one of nine Scottish youth companies performing new plays for and about young people by some of Scotland’s best contemporary playwrights as part of the New Connections programme; is aware that LYT, founded in 2002, has almost 200 students ranging in age from three to 19 and strongly supported by enthusiastic local volunteers from the wider Largs community; recognises the hard work and dedication of the young students who will participate in Blackout, the leadership and commitment provided by the directors of LYT, Andrew McGregor and Marianne Yeomans, and wishes everyone connected with LYT continued success in the future. Supported by: Aileen Campbell, Michael Matheson, Rob Gibson, Robin Harper, Stuart McMillan, Sandra White, Stewart Maxwell, Ross Finnie, Bill Kidd, Jamie Hepburn, Anne McLaughlin, Elaine Smith, Gil Paterson
S3M-3934 Largs Youth Theatre (lodged on 21 April 2009) Karen Whitefield*
